intro: Fagelia helianthemoides, commonly known as the yellow sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in xerophytic plant adaptations.
